abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated as
            satisfactory, sustainability as likely, and the
            institutional development impact is substantial,
            accomplished through highly satisfactory performances by the
            Bank and Borrower. The multi-sectoral preparation team was
            highly experienced in technical issues and operational
            procedures, and the operation successfully built on the
            Bank's substantial experience in the health, education
            and social protection sectors, accumulated through lending,
            and sector work, whereas the commitment of both the
            outgoing, and incoming administrations, to human
            development, ensuring the continuity of successful social
            programs, was instrumental in the smooth process of design,
            and implementation. This simplified Implementation
            Completion Report (ICR) provides the following major factors
            affecting both implementation, and outcome. The choice of
            instrument, programmatic adjustment lending, was highly
            relevant, reflecting an appropriate mix of actions, oriented
            to achieving short-term macroeconomic and sectoral impacts,
            as well as those aimed at sustaining the sectors'
            long-term development goals. Furthermore, it ensured partial
            financing of the nominal fiscal deficit, and the external
            financial requirements of the public sector, while
            protecting sound social programs. The complementarity with
            other multi-lateral organizations, i.e., the assistance
            provided by the Inter-American Development Bank (IADB) to
            Brazil in the social sectors, consistent with the ongoing
            International Monetary Fund (IMF) standby arrangement,
            supported enhancements to four successful cash transfer
            programs (Bolsa Alimenta��o, Bolsa Escola, Agente Jovem, and
            Programa de Erradica��o do Trabalho Infantil), ensuring the
            protection of vulnerable groups, under a tight fiscal
            environment, and the continuation of successful social
            programs, while promoting greater efficiency in those
            programs. Findings and implications for subsequent
            Programmatic Human Development Sector Reform Loan (PSRL)
            stages address: the improved efficiency in the use of public
            resources in the social sectors, suggesting the Technical
            Assistance Loan, currently under preparation, remains of
            foremost importance to the subsequent phases of this
            operation; the promotion of further alignment with state,
            and municipal policies, and close monitoring at all levels
            is strongly advised; continued benefiting from seasoned
            multi-sector preparation, and supervision team who selected
            the set of social programs, fully functional, and with a
            solid track record; and, the successful integration of
            activities, and reform programs for education, heath, and
            social protection along cross-cutting programmatic and
            reform themes.
